POOF.content: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía
POOF.linkedContent: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía

PP.content: Ra, Ammon (hidden), hidden sun, the father of all things (came from an egg, and origin of egg); answer to “the chicken or the egg”: “O Ra, who art in thy egg,” a “hidden egg”
PP.linkedContent: Ra, Ammon (hidden), hidden sun, the father of all things (came from an egg, and origin of egg); answer to “the chicken or the egg”: “O Ra, who art in thy egg,” a “hidden egg”

PP.content: Hermes’ stealing and stealing away not the hidden of father, fixed design
PP.linkedContent: Hermes’ stealing and stealing away not the hidden of father, fixed design

PAS.content: border edge, hidden vicinity (un voisinage caché) [not depth]
PAS.linkedContent: border edge, hidden vicinity (un voisinage caché) [not depth]

WM.content: Leibniz seeking to find hidden concept or name beneath all syntactical relations
WM.linkedContent: Leibniz seeking to find hidden concept or name beneath all syntactical relations

WM.content: for Bachelard, the hidden (fire) is what demands metaphors, Derrida explains how this conceptualization, despite fact that Bachelard appeals to syntax, “a poetic mind is a syntax of metaphors,” still amounts to metaphor of the same > here, all metaphors have a semantic focal point, the hidden fire as life, nature
WM.linkedContent: for Bachelard, the hidden (fire) is what demands metaphors, Derrida explains how this conceptualization, despite fact that Bachelard appeals to syntax, “a poetic mind is a syntax of metaphors,” still amounts to metaphor of the same > here, all metaphors have a semantic focal point, the hidden fire as life, nature

WM.content: one true metaphor (no more true metaphor): but assured legibility of the proper [presence disappearing in its own radiance, hidden source of light]
WM.linkedContent: one true metaphor (no more true metaphor): but assured legibility of the proper [presence disappearing in its own radiance, hidden source of light]

ROP.content: if the verborgene Sinn (hidden sense) (of dream), omphalos, is homogenous to order of analyzable > psychoanalytic reason as hermeneutic
ROP.linkedContent: if the verborgene Sinn (hidden sense) (of dream), omphalos, is homogenous to order of analyzable > psychoanalytic reason as hermeneutic

ROP.content: [here] analytic concern merges w/ hermeneutic drive, w/ principle of reason (reddere rationem): render sense at all cost (à tout prix), il faut rendre: fidelity, debt, duty, to restitute sense of sense > even if hidden, verborgene Sinn
ROP.linkedContent: [here] analytic concern merges w/ hermeneutic drive, w/ principle of reason (reddere rationem): render sense at all cost (à tout prix), il faut rendre: fidelity, debt, duty, to restitute sense of sense > even if hidden, verborgene Sinn

REST.content: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)
REST.linkedContent: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)

REST.content: the hiding or veiling, figure of the veil, is drawn into undecidability by the hymen
REST.linkedContent: the hiding or veiling, figure of the veil, is drawn into undecidability by the hymen

REST.content: Derrida wonders if topos of abyss (a fortiori mis-en-abyme) might dampen (amortir) the angular necessity of this other topic, other pas: undecidables, la figure du voilement, du linge voilant, l’hymen, la soquette ou le bas, entre pied et chaussure
REST.linkedContent: Derrida wonders if topos of abyss (a fortiori mis-en-abyme) might dampen (amortir) the angular necessity of this other topic, other pas: undecidables, la figure du voilement, du linge voilant, l’hymen, la soquette ou le bas, entre pied et chaussure

RM.content: Verhüllung (veiling), Verborgenheit (being-hidden), Being withholds (se retient), withdraws (se retire) (sich entzieht), retrait
RM.linkedContent: Verhüllung (veiling), Verborgenheit (being-hidden), Being withholds (se retient), withdraws (se retire) (sich entzieht), retrait

AFR.content: Condillac replaces a metaphysics of essences/causes (the hidden) w/ metaphysics of phenomena & relation (the open)
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac replaces a metaphysics of essences/causes (the hidden) w/ metaphysics of phenomena & relation (the open)

SPEC.content: several families (in French analytic movement) bear same name [Freud’s name?] w/out knowing it [via Marie Bonaparte; “au moment où on croit décacheter (unsealed) un testament”]

FV.content: footnotes show what must not be said > Schelling: “[footnotes] should remain hidden”
